unnormalised: New Census Data: We're Officially *How* Many?!
normalised: New Census Data: We are Officially How Many?!

unnormalised: New Delhi: Apparently, counting people is harder than getting auto-rickshaws to use their meters! The 2024 census data is finally out, and let’s just say the numbers are, uh, substantial. Initial estimates peg India’s population at a whopping 1.45 billion! Yes, that's billion with a "B." Looks like someone needs to order a bigger chai kettle.
normalised: New Delhi: Apparently, counting people is harder than getting auto-rickshaws to use their meters! The two thousand and twenty four census data is finally out, and let us just say the numbers are, uh, substantial. Initial estimates peg India’s population at a whopping one point four five billion! Yes, that is billion with a "B". Looks like someone needs to order a bigger chai kettle.

unnormalised: According to the report, our population growth rate is currently at 0.9%, which statistically means that roughly every 3 seconds someone is thinking "Maybe I should have another helping of biryani!" or "Is my neighbour's dog barking louder than usual?". At least, that's what we assume the statisticians meant.
normalised: According to the report, our population growth rate is currently at zero point nine percent, which statistically means that roughly every three seconds someone is thinking "Maybe I should have another helping of biryani!" or "Is my neighbour's dog barking louder than usual?". At least, that is what we assume the statisticians meant.

unnormalised: Interestingly, the data also reveals that 65% of the population is under 35. So, basically, two-thirds of the country is trying to figure out how to adult while simultaneously battling Wi-Fi issues and convincing their parents that being a "social media influencer" *is* a real job.
normalised: Interestingly, the data also reveals that sixty five percent of the population is under thirty five. So, basically, two-thirds of the country is trying to figure out how to adult while simultaneously battling Wi-Fi issues and convincing their parents that being a "social media influencer" is a real job.

unnormalised: Maharashtra continues to be one of the most populous states with a figure nearing 130 million, followed closely by UP at around 240 million. Experts say this is largely due to the irresistible allure of vada pav and the sheer number of weddings that seem to happen every. single. day. It's all about those buffets!
normalised: Maharashtra continues to be one of the most populous states with a figure nearing one hundred and thirty million, followed closely by U-P at around two hundred and forty million. Experts say this is largely due to the irresistible allure of vada pav and the sheer number of weddings that seem to happen every. single. day. It is all about those buffets!

unnormalised: In conclusion, congratulations, India! We’ve officially aced the “most people in one place” competition. Now, if we could just figure out how to parallel park without needing divine intervention, that would be great. Next on the agenda, figuring out how to get reliable data on the number of people who actually understand GST returns. That's a number even God couldn't calculate!
normalised: In conclusion, congratulations, India! We have officially aced the “most people in one place” competition. Now, if we could just figure out how to parallel park without needing divine intervention, that would be great. Next on the agenda, figuring out how to get reliable data on the number of people who actually understand G-S-T returns. That is a number even God couldn't calculate!
